content: Bought this many years ago but could never get it to load anything. What system files do I need and where do I put them?
Just started testing it, but seems to work perfectly so far, the best one on the Play Store. Using on Android 10.
The keyboard sucks. Most of the symbols are missing. This is emulating computers, not a video console, so it should be capable of more than just games.
Doesn't work, and website for instructions will not load.
Best support for all games and game control devices, even the Xbox One controller.
Very poor interface makes this virtually useless.

Too hard to set up. I really wanted to support this emulator because I know the developer actually keeps his apps updated but this is just too hard to set up. I downloaded outdated vice android emulator copied the files for the 1541disk drives & other drives as well as the bios& copied them over & it wouldn't work. Too much messing around while other C64 emulator boot you straight into BASIC with a virtual keyboard & joystick already set up. On this app the set up process is unnecessarily long.
It sucks. Can't find anywhere how to make it work. Link on website doesnt work. Waste of money
For a paid app it's very user unfriendly. Additional software is required. I would not recommend it for tech unsavvy like myself.

Works great with my Nvidia Shield TV 2015. Nvidia controller also works well. Having to get extra files to make it work in a little bit of a pain but worth it. I had trouble because I wanted my games on the SD card and the required files on the internal storage did not work... Seems games must be on internal storage as well. I love the turbo button on the controller that increases CPU speed to get thru different things quicker great convenient feature. In my opinion well with the money!
UPDATE: OK, I figured it out! You have to download certain files for this to work! Now it works like a charm! Great emulator, all in all!

This app is awesome. It loads the games super fast. You have to do some work to get it working though. You have to download and install the VICE support & firmware files. After that it works great. The games also work using retroarch but they take a very long time to load. Long live the C64.

Excellent emulation bar none, and I was looking for an emulator besides ViceC64 (non-intuitive GUI) that supported swapping disk images live. This was the only one I found. However, the on-screen keyboard is missing crucial C64 keys and maps the arrow keys wrong. I can't move around the screen at all without working arrow keys. So I docked two stars. Please fix.
Runs too fast. Even though it's set to PAL mode it still goes too fast. Can't change frame rate to anything less than 60hz either, when it should be 50hz.
Excellent emulator,the best you can get
Best emulator available for the Commodore family of computers from the VIC-20 to the C=128 & of course the C=64. Keep up the great work all of your emulator are top notch. üëçüéÆ

Better than the real thing. Games run like the old days and controls are very adaptable. The developer is continually engaged with apps improvements. Just waiting for this awesome developers Amiga 500 emu üòÅ

I must say, this is the best Commodore emulator I've used to date. It is exactly what I'd been looking for. It's worth all 5 stars and every penny I paid for it. The only suggestion I might have, is to improve the emulator by revamping the keyboard (in landscape mode) to mirror the original exactly... but that not withstanding, I'd highly recommend this to anyone.
Too much more to do to make this work. Pal mode does nothing, NTSC runs too fast.
Stopped working on my Wikipad along with all Robert Brugila emulators with latest updates. I paid for the full versions too!!! Been working fine for 4 years!!!
Good emulation Not easy for start but need to try

Still the best C64 emulator. I don't understand the low reviews as it's very easy to get up and running and it looks + performs amazingly. I have recently purchased a Galaxy Note 10 after being on iPhone for a couple of years and C64.emu was one of my first purchases, I used C64.emu years ago back in 2013 when I owned a Nexus 7 android tablet and loved it back then, it has gotten even better with time. It looks amazing on my Note 10 after tweaking the screensize and turning on scanlines..

Ok you have to copy a few files over which is really easy especially if your familiar with Vice Basically seems to run everything I have thrown at it and continues to. You can load .D64, .CRT, T64 and TAP files with ease. Any that fail is more likely down to the crack in the game so just try another version. Very happy with this one :)
Couldn't get it to load even simple disc like jet set willy 2, the error message said something about missing system files? I'll stick to free emulators like vice and frodo64
Not the usual quality Im used to seeing from this developer...
i use it to watch all the latest demos and it always delivers! well worth the money!
did not work. kept getting an error upon load

Quick one line summary of review: Would give it zero stars instead, but google doesnt let me do that. Awful and terrible emulator. Keyboard doesn't allow special characters. Not every program loads. You need to provide the C64 bios yourself. The emulator is specifically designed for gaming and pretty much useless for other stuff. There are free emulators that provide more functions and options, so no, not satisfied with purchase!
sorry but it doesn't have anything involved to D64 so not gonna have long service on this one so I got the refund.

This is BEST C64 emulator for Android and the ONLY show in town for those that want usability. After struggling with the other apps I regret not getting it earlier. It's well thought out with a virtual keyboard easily accessed to navigate game loading screens, and the ability to connect a physical keyboard. The touch controls are horrendous, static and outdated, and need to be updated with dynamic controls that allow for drift outside the virtual joystick region, but a gamepad works just fine.
Works well on my GPD XD+. thank you.

Best Commodore 64 emulator for Android. Very helpful with my BASIC and assembly language projects. I agree that an option to start the emulator directly into BASIC (like turning on a real C64) would be helpful, but starting with a "blank floppy disk" works just as well. Most of the 1-star reviews are likely coming from those who have no idea what they're doing. The app is basically a portable version of the excellent Vice emulator, and is geared towards hobbyists. 100% recommended.
How do I receive a refund? I already contacted you about a refund. Horrible customer service. I told you I was not satisfied and you refuse to give me a refund.

Probably the easiest to use c64 emulator. Although it doesn't seem to save states so I have to suffer long load times each boot. I have auto save checked, and manual save doesn't work either. Fast forward and warp speed don't cut it - they need to be even faster!!

Ridiculous. Saw online that supposedly this is much better than frodo and that other one, but it doesn't even run. You try to load a game, then get a red error box about needing a vice printer or something, which disappears after about a second. Then it says it needs to exit. Try again, same thing. Zero help on the website. Getting a refund while I still can.

Frustrated even after following directions for setup. Can't get to a boot screen or even load a game. This emulator is useless to me at this point. At least Frodo for free I can load a game, bit still experience issue during play. This emulator is obviously not user friendly. Would not recommend spending the money, better to get a free one and buy a coke.
2 thumbs down. I couldn't get anything working. I tried reaching out to the developer but didn't get a response. Would've been better off spending my $ on a Snickers bar.

Best C64 emulator I've seen on Android. An option to drop straight to BASIC would be useful, and the keyboard needs a bit(!) of work, but I'm not dropping a star for that.  You do need the copyrighted ROM files from elsewhere but they're available via a quick search and easy enough to drop into the right folder. Child's play for anyone familiar with emulators in general.
got it working flawlessly. had all my games in one folder, not advised.
it's a shame it doesn't tell Android it can launch prg or d64 files as i load them from Google Drive

OK, so I was not happy that this does not work out of the box, and the instructions didn't work either (chromebooks are weird with the file system). You have to download some files and then tell the app where to find them. Once working this is cool.
App requires manual hacking to get installed an. Has the most aweful onscreen controls I've evereseen. The custom keyboard is unusable.

Took a minute to get it going, but I got it. I made a folder on my sd card where I keep my roms. I put the zipped file there and I put an unzipped folder in there too..go to options...system...system file path...I looked for that folder and clicked on c64...üòé
Audio is broken in all of Robert's emulators across all my devices, contacted the dev several times but received no response

Garbage can't access or play any games I've used multiple file systems bios zip I've even installed c64 games pack and no matter what I do I can't play games Robert broglia is a great developer I've purchased alot of his emulators and they are great but this one sucks don't buy this app you'll just get error messages when you try to play your roms
By far the best c64 emulator for Android. Bar none.

This is one of the better C64 emulators on Play Store just now. Plenty of 
options for tweaking to get those awkward games running. It would be great 
to see a more customisable control screen with both joystick and keyboard 
visible at the same time or a way to have customised buttons onscreen as 
with the magicDOS app. And finally, although c64 files are small they 
quickly add up and can occupy a lot of memory. How about Dropbox support 
for files? Oh and if it could run .prg files that'd be great. Edit: I 
notice it's started to run slow on my Nexus7FHD which is annoying as it 
used to run great. I've removed a star for this reason.

The best c64 emulator there is. The installation takes a couple of steps 
but is really a no brainer. I have only tried a handful of games and they 
have all worked great. This even saves the game so you can resume anytime 
you want. My only complaint is the keyboard - typing out Load "filename",8 
is painfully difficult. Is there a way to run a fastload cartridge?? 
Overall 10/10 having a blast with it.
The best C64 emulator in the play store...
This is one of the best emulators I ever purchased as it let me play commodore 16 as well!!! Well done on the developer!! I wish it could play .prg as well then it would simply amazing!!!!
It's there away to make the keyboard darker as it's hard to see sometimes when a game is loaded..
$3.99 wasted!

I rated this down on the controls despite my immense love for this emulator, and this is for one simple reason, its that many games require you to be able to stop the tape at certain points, and this currently has no tape deck control support

Love It! Works perfectly on an Xperia XA1 and much easier than setting up VICE on a Desktop PC, plus I can take C64 with me. Does anyone know the name of the racing game shown in the screenshots on Play? I used to play it when I was 18 in the pub
Perfect emulation of the C64. Using M9C Max Android TV Box. Thank you.
Very complicated...
Takes me back to my childhood mint well worth 2.99

Invest the time to learn how to use it and this emulator works well. However, save states don`t work properly - giving an I/O error if you use tape (.tap) files. Otherwise, it`s not bad although it could do with an update to a more recent version of the Vice source.
Great but I still can't get Alter Ego to work with a c64 emulator
Brilliant, works superbly. Bringing back my youth
Great emulator. Super simple to set up. Brings back all the memories of my first computer
Seems to not respond to wikipad buttons in games but recognizes them in the menus, not sure why but very frustrating, as apart from that its a superb emulator
A very good emulator but you will need the bios files for the emulator. Just down load winvice from a Google search and put it into the root of the device in a folder called c64.emu

How do you get an on screen keyboard? I set the most common keys onto my game pad but there are always other keys needed at times, so I'm just sticking to VICE on my laptop at the moment . I see people mentioning a keyboard here but I cannot figure out how to get it to display!
Followed every instruction and NEVER worked. Error loading file every game. Scam scam scam
Best C64 emu on android. But a search function to find games in large collections would be great!
Excellent once you've figured it out.

Totally didn't work at all. When you unzip the supporting files in the root directory of the sd card as instructed you get an extra layer of C64.emu directory. No problem, did the usual rename, move, rename, delete manouver, but then the app still can't see any of its files. They are there, according to the file manager, but the app says "directory empty." This happened no matter where I moved C64.emu: /storage/0/sdcard, /storage/emulated/0, my documents directory, you name it. If it's that hard to get the darn thing to work they should pay the user $3.99 for the effort.
One of the best c64 emu around.
As others have said recently. The keyboard and on screen joypad only work occasionaly and only with certain games. Please fix this
Doesn't seem to work on Galaxy S6. Emailed developer 3 times over two weeks asking for assistance and when they didn't reply, a refund. I have yet to receive a reply.

It has fast forward what is nice and it works, with some graphics glitches - for example Golden Axe - main character draw is a bit broken.   Initial setup was annoying, im too old to read some hyperlink from readme manual pages - support pay & play, its something like plug and play for Win95:)          Just add some "you need some files" popup and download them after 1st app execution..     And adding some files right into sdcard root, its like add something into Linux root or C:\, be more mature developer!
Bought this.  Doesn't work and I can't refund it.    Rip off!!!

C64 emulator available, worth every penny and it's great being able to play some classic c64 titles on my Android devices, I just wish the author would also make an Amiga emulator so well (hint hint).  Why is this app not rated a maximum 5.0, it should be as it's the best emulator on Android and using it is even more of a joy know that I've brought an USB adaptor that let's you connect db9 joysticks to usb  devices. Just played through last ninja 2 using my quickshot 2 turbo joystick. Why are people moaning or saying it's  a hassle having to copy the 3 folders from vice to get this emulator working, C'mon people it's not hard or a hassle to do that to get this great emulator working is it!!??

Struggled to get this working initially, not working again after marshmallow update. Some support from the developer but now back to system files can't be found. At wits end with this wish i hadn't purchased this all the other emulators work. Tiresome now.

Got it to work finally. Quite a hassle to download and install additional files. I think the problem was that the unzip program puts the c64.emu in an extra folder, so c64.emu/c64.emu/c64 drives c128 etc. I copied the second c64.emu folder and put that in the root menu of the internal storage. After that move I got it to work. Maybe there are other solutions, post them in the app review, to help others. Ciao
Back to working flawlessly again. Great work.
Now I can play all those fantastic games that took forever to load!!!

You have to download the C64 support files zip file after installing. A bit of a pain but 5***** for the emulator because once it's running it's faultless. I emailed the Dev and got a quick reply. Now I can play Monty Mole and Fort Apocalypse on my mobile. Happy days.

Great emulator - best c64 one on Android . The recent update seemed to sort out the blank screen problem post Marshmallow,  but now the screen d-pad doesn't work on most games (though it still works on some). Developer,  are others having this problem and could this be sorted out with an update?

Now i got it going, its much faster than other c64 emulators, and sound even works properly. Thanks... Revising since getting a new phone. Simply cannot figure it out. I know it works well when it does but its been ages since i figured how to make it work and now i cant remember, so its become worthless.

This emu is still being developed so expect a few minor hitches...The addition of the other systems such as Vic20 and Plus/4 is superb, but do require a bit of patience to execute them properly. I have no doubt that Robert will iron out any problems in the near future. The C64 was not a cartridge based console so does require a bit of savvy to implement all the features available in this emulator..P.S. Great to see Mighty Bogg supporting this emu, legend from my teenage years...Crunchy Frog forever...
I get the sound from the loaded ROM, just no video. Hmmmmmm. (Motorola xforce Marshmallow)
I can load games but get only a black screen on my S7 Edge. :(
Is crap don't get it
Painful to setup when it doesn't need to be, especially for a paid app.

I tried everything to get this app to work, internet searches for what i am missing or doing wrong, i downloaded zarchiver and astro file manager,  saved the rom in set place and it still comes up system files missing!!! Grr hours wasted...should be a whole lot easier to save and store roms... i only downloaded it to get back my favourite childhood game flimbo's quest.... its as bad as trying to load a tape on the original commodore 64
Doesn't load Roms.  Rubbish

Sadly.. here to make money. And after 5 fails and non working key commands ... i just had to say. Software has to be baaad for me to say something... and i am saying something. Go dig out your old c64 and let this guy eat a vic... 20.

So me of my .tap games require a change of tape side during load up and while I can change the tape side, there isn't an option to "rewind" or press "play" as requested by the game  running on the emulator. Particularly the game Summer Camp which is what I'm trying to play.
Took me right back to the mid 80s. Followed the directions, unzipped vice files at the root of storage as C64.emu, launched the first game and boom! Functionality is amazing!! Great job!!

Like this guy's collection of emulators but this one I'm having trouble with. Cannot get the roms to load. I've tried emailing Robert but no replies from my 2 I've sent. His partner website.....nothing. it's been about 2 weeks and after determination of tinkering with it its just taking up space and cannot get it to work üò†

Good UI, great controls, initial set up a little fiddly for the average user but once through that it is awesome! As The Mighty Bogg in my late teens I was a huge C64 geek, and it appears I still am, just shy of my 50th birthday..

No matter where I put the vice & c64 files, program refuses to load ANY c64 programs; disk or tape... Waiting to hear something else I will want a refund...  *UPDATE* After figuring out whatever it was in the file system that was messed up, this thing is BEAUTIFUL... Save states means that high score tables can be saved, even in games that didn't have saving high score support... HOWEVER... whether your game runs in NTSC, or PAL, MAKE SURE when you select your C64's emulation operating system that you select the same operating system you saved the game with, otherwise the saved game may not load... On screen joystick is nice, even gives you the chance to add F1 button support on screen (for a total of two game pad buttons + 1 F key); My advice to the programmer? Maybe make an extra button or two and make them BOTH mappable to whatever key you want... That way, a game like Spelunker would be easier to play, as you wouldn't have to switch from keyboard to joystick (which is neat)... Games play well, even selecting disks is a breeze...
I got this because it is compatible with Gamesome. But it takes ages to load games and those that do load do not work properly.
Every other c64 emulator is better than the one that wants money.
Does not work on Shield Android TV. Copied the folders C64, DRIVES and PRINTER to my sdcard and C64.emu is still complaining about missing files. Also tried custom path.
Frodo is free and easier to use , got my money refunded, shame really if the developer could just make the setup easier it would be OK.

No funky sdl type controls so that's good. Tried it on a tape game (Wizball) and a disk game (IK+), worked a treat, better then any other C64 emulator I've tried. Installation steps - went to website, downloaded files to download directory. Used FS FileExplorer to extract file to /sdcard/ which is the root directory of my Tegra Note 7. I then actually bought the App via play store. Used the App to find stored C64 game (in my case a sub-directory in downloads). Very happy!! Now to test  further.

Same issue, just bought it and cant find installed files anywhere, wont recognize any games i try to load giving me the move VICE files error. Why wouldnt i have needed files already? EDIT : You can download the system files separately from the internet, and this emulator is probably the best c64 one for android i found. Only 3 stars because of lack of instruction and making you pay for a program that doesnt include everything needed, such a hassle.

I just bought this and cant load any games into it, it comes up with red band indicating: system files c64, drives, Printer from VICE or set custom path /storage/emulated/0/c64.emu  ?  am i missing files why would these not come with a paid for emulator?
Complains about system files and custom directory. Couldn't load anything instant flop for me.
Didn't work on my phone but had it worked I'm sure I'd have loved it!
Not what i wanted how do i get refund
Refund and uninstalled. I'm sure it would be great but cannot even start the app. Website after website and download after download, unzip and extract files to certain directory and still didnt work.
The keyboard needs a esc key. Can't start might and magic without it... Other then that its the best one I have used
Now if I could only figure out how to use it.  I figured out one of the free apps.  But it didn't support .tap files.  Maybe I just wasn't meant to play M.u.l.e. again?  Lol
Keyboard bug fixed. Thanks to the developer for such quick action. A+ : )
Copied the rom to every directory possible! This p.o.s. kept telling me it was missing files.   Sick of trying.  Give me my money back!
Great stuff! Bit fiddly to set up but worth it! Connect your device to your telly and you're back in the 80s!! :o)
works great and have all the features you will need to watch demos and play games, with the latest update the sound skipping on pal is fixed thank you dev!
Another great title from this dev.

I had one image which was not working properly but only this emu allowed to switch from NTSC to PAL to fix the trouble.. also controls are smooth on my nvidia shield portable. One issue thou is that the keyboard is not always working as it should

A great emulator that would have been perfect if it wasn't for what I think is a bug when trying to load and save .tap games. It saves the state but gives a FILE I/O error message when trying to load the state. Save states work for disk images though, but not for tape images (not tried .crt saves as I don't even know if it supports cart images)... I use .tap images mainly because I like the loading music which brings back all the memories of the past and makes it totally authentic. I don't know if the developers will read this but if they do it would be fantastic if they could fix this to make it absolutely perfect...
A recent update broke an audio effect with resid found in Onslaught's cracktro of Micro Hexagon, aka Cheese.sid.
Very difficult to get working. works on experia play partially. Cannot get it to work on galaxy tab 2 or samsung galaxy mega phone.
Awesome
Excellent emulator with a great interface!
A lot of games use the @;:/ let's for cursor controls.  Why isn't there a closer mapping for the c64 layout?
Tried Frodo but always choppy sound despite altering settings.  Having originally owned a c64 in the 80's this app is amazing to see and play on a Galaxy Tab 4 and a PS3 controller. Thanks guys :)

A great work, an excellent emulator. I love the feature of having a "recent games" list and also the possibility of creating direct shortcuts for games on your android device's desktop. Also, the colors are the original ones, and the emulator in phones uses a big part of the screen, and the controls can be customized in position and size. In all this, the advantages over others are enormous. Please keep the good work with c64.emu! Thank you!
Can re-live my youth once more thanks to this fantastic, easy to use emulator. Just need a similar one for the Amiga now! Well done, and thank you!

I used Frodo 64 on my old tablet, and liked it very much.  However, on my new tablet, it can not utilize virtual buttons, so I needed to find a new emulator.   First, I needed more than to just install the app, I also needed to download Vice, and copy it to my tablet.  I don't see why this wasn't all in one package.  Second, the games load very slowly.  They run just fine, but it takes a few to get them going.  Third, it will only load the first file on the disk image (load"*",8,1).  Some of my games, Forbidden Forest for example, don't load that way.  Honestly, if I could get Frodo to work on my new tablet, I would uninstall this.  If you can use Frodo, try that first; and it's free.
Brilliant emulator, works like a charm.  Please do an Amiga 1200 emulator, I'll be forever happy!  Anyways, keep up the good work, love your emulators, thank you.
Had it for a long while, thought I had reviewed it, all I can say it's the best emu for c64 out there

So this emulator has to be one of the best C64 emulators for Android. Followed instructions and set everything up and all is working. For the people complaining that they can't set it up or that it should be set up from the get go, follow the instructions and learn how to set it up or like always, Google is your friend....

Once you get it running this is a brilliant emulator. I am vexed by people being disparaging of this developers work due to frustration at their own stupidity! If you can load programs on a c64 you should have enough brains to read the instructions and set up this emulator. If you can't, ask for help, but don't criticise the developers work because he cannot legally distribute the software with the ROMs included and preconfigured.
Can't get it to work.
Was having trouble getting anything to work, but after playing around with settings i managed to get it to work. Can finally play some old school games :)
Nice emulator

Been playing some really nice games with this earlier. And it was very easy to set up my JXD controls. My only request would be this... Any chance you can make a C16/Plus 4 emulator too. As I feel that this can benefit greatly from this author's expertise.
But, I am still unable to get the even numbered function keys (F2,  F4 etc.) to show up on the emu keyboard. :(

This app crashes on startup when converted to a system app by Titanium Backup. When converted back to a user app and clearing its' cache and data, it seems to work fine. I'm giving only 4 out of 5 stars as a result of this. My device is a Galaxy Note 3 (T-Mobile), rooted and with custom TWRP recovery, running Temasek's Unofficial CyanogenMod 11 ROM.

This is one of the better ports of Vice to the Android operating system but still has some minor problems with the sound emulation and synchronisation which kills it a bit for me. I get audio buffer problems regardless of which SID emulation I use where the sound will glitch or blanks out for a split second every 15-20 seconds. I would like to see also a better keyboard layout as it is not easy to achieve some standard C64 keystrokes. There are also some other bugs in the keyboard layout such as the enter key on the number entry page doesn't appear to do anything. I would like to see these items addressed for a better rating. Using Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1.
Took me a bit of playing around to figure it out, but worth the effort. Much better than the other Commodore emulators I've tried.
Doesn't work on my new HTC one  m8
Works like a charm!
I am getting the error...system files missing, place c64, drives, & printer directories from vice in a path below, or set a custom path in options: /storage/emulated/0/c64.emu  Please help!

By far the best C64 emulator that I've ever used. I really do have my old C64 back, plus tons more games and utilities than I ever even dreamed of having, all with me on my phone. Life is good.   I'd give this App 10 stars if they'd let me.  One thing, it needs a drive light to let a person know that a disk is loading and isn't just stalled.
Ive been using Frodo for a couple of years. It was ok but the sound was choppy. This app fixes this. Another great emu from Robert. Five stars

Finally an emulator that will run legacy of the ancients, 1 other thing aswell for ppl out there, use x-plore to unzip this, if u use winzip it will decompress it without the directories and u will get errors when u try to run games

I tried them all...   this one is easily the best.  I will be honest I really like the way the c64 gold emulator shows a mini keyboard up on the screen however i couldnt find the on screen controller...  i dont want to use an external gamepad jeezlaweeze....   the gui sucks on that too....  this one is perfect....   quick trip to the website, buy this, setup the buttons (put fast forward on screen) and im in frickin heaven....   good job dev!  I just wish i had a joystick swap button i could put onscreen   or if there is one id like to know where it is!  its easy to do now you just have to leave your game lol   thanks much eh?

Really great c64 emulator. It's the only Android emu I've found that can play Heart of Africa and Seven Cities of Gold. I wish I'd found this one sooner. I will definitely look to the developer for other emus in the future.
Won't work for my phone
How the heck do u use this app? Tried loading games, but has red box on bottom saying what 2 do but don't understand.
The on screen keyboard is a bit of a pain to use but not a deal breaker since there are other options.

I've used many Commodore 64 emulators on many different platforms over the years. And this one is the best, all my games run flawlessly on it and I especially like the scanline image filters and aspect ratio / zoom options, which make the games graphics look exactly how I remembered them back in the 80s on an old TV or Commodore crt monitor. Many many thanks for producing such a top notch emulator.
I purchased this for my Samsung galaxy tab 3, and it won't let me open any of the c64 games I download. Please fix!!!!
This has pretty much played every game I've thrown at it. Another great emulator by this publisher.
After having tried out all the rest in the Google Play store for C64 Emulation this one can't be beat. Supports my USB joystick, and I now have a BT controller on order.
Does not work on my new Sony experia grrr,waste of money.
Wonderful app, extremely easy-to-use. Really brings memory's from when I was a kid. Works really slick on a Galaxy Note 3. Thanks for all your hard work :-)
I need help. My roms is not working please help me

The only C64 emulator worth having , initially had trouble loading games but just had to turn off the turbo loading mode in settings. This is the only C64 emulator on Android that loads Creatures. Nice 1.
When I try to play a game all I get is a purple screen.
Can't get it to work with any roms. Waste of 4 bucks

Tested with Nvidia Shield.   The Emu is better than the rest I tried.  The sound is still not quite perfect yet though.  I get stutters and hiccups in the sound every once in awhile (every 5-10 seconds usually).  I tried both SID options but I couldn't tell any difference. The interface is pleasant to use. The port appears to be Vice x64.exe and not the x64sc.exe. A Bluetooth keyboard can be set up quickly. Most of the important options are implemented but some missed options will frustrate veteran C64 users.    1. Missing disk write protect tab option. Some original games like Bounty Bob have protection that either erases your disk or fails to load if the disk is writable. Please add an option for a read-only disk.   2. The UI forces users to automatically load something before starting. I work around this by using an Action Replay 6.crt cartridge to start up.    3. Missing freezer button for Action Replay 6.   4. The hardware reset does not reset all RAM as seen with ‚ÄúSheep In Space‚Äù A soft reset would be nice to have. The disk should to have its own reset.  5. Missing parent directory navigation when using the ROM DISK TAPE control. The workaround is to merge folders.    I rate 3 stars. C64 emulators require a surprising amount of sophistication to run the most demanding titles. If these items are fixed then I would rate 4 stars. If an x64sc option is available too then 5 stars would be in order.  Keep up the good work!

Further down the road, I'd love to see a skinned real c64 keyboard, like beebdroid or zed ex, they would look great on a tablet.
